availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh L. White (Clay County, Kentucky, salt maker, and merchant)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, salt maker and merchant. Clay County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary E. A. Chastain White in Clay County, Kentucky, on May 20, 1847. Father of Alexander White. Married to Lucy W. Bates White in Clay County, Kentucky, on October 9, 1855. Father of Susan White, Olivia White, and Stephen H. White. Salt maker in Clay County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Merchant in Clay County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860. Employed Nancy Jones as a servant in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 143B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 349A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, District 1, p. 171A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film 007728056.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994031, Clay County Marriages.
"Died." Richmond Climax, (Richmond, KY), May 27, 1891, p. 3.
